jparsec.time

Class TimeFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.time.TimeFormat

  • public class TimeFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple set of date and time formatters.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    M. Huss, T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • dateNow

        public static java.lang.String dateNow(int dateFmt)
        Return 'now' as a date String using the default Locale.
        Parameters:
        dateFmt - The java.text.DateFormat constant to use (FULL, LONG, MEDIUM, or SHORT).
        Returns:
        The current, formatted, date as a String.

      • dateNow

        public static java.lang.String dateNow()
        Return 'now' as a date String using the default Locale and the DateFormat.MEDIUM size.
        Returns:
        The current formatted date as a String.

      • dateTimeNow

        public static java.lang.String dateTimeNow()
        Return 'now' as a date and time String using the default Locale and the DateFormat.MEDIUM size.
        Returns:
        The current, formatted, date and time as a String.

      • formatJulianDayAsDateAndTime

        public static java.lang.String formatJulianDayAsDateAndTime(double jd,
                                            TimeElement.SCALE scale)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Converts a julian day into a date and time String.
        Parameters:
        jd - The julian day. Must be greater than 0.
        scale - The time scale to add its abbreviation at the end, or null to avoid it.
        Returns:
        The date and time formatted as a String.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the Julian day is invalid.

      • formatJulianDayAsDateAndTime

        public static java.lang.String formatJulianDayAsDateAndTime(TimeElement time,
                                            boolean dmy,
                                            boolean monthAsString)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Converts a julian day into a date and time String.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        dmy - True to format as day-month-year, false for year-month-day.
        monthAsString - True to write the month as a string.
        Returns:
        The date and time formatted as a String.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the Julian day is invalid.

      • formatJulianDayAsDateAndTimeOnlyMinutes

        public static java.lang.String formatJulianDayAsDateAndTimeOnlyMinutes(double jd,
                                                       TimeElement.SCALE scale)
                                                                throws JPARSECException
        Converts a julian day into a date and time String.
        Parameters:
        jd - The julian day.
        scale - The time scale to add its abbreviation at the end, or null to avoid it.
        Returns:
        The date and time formatted as a String.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the Julian day is invalid.

      • formatJulianDayAsDateAndTimeOnlyMinutes

        public static java.lang.String formatJulianDayAsDateAndTimeOnlyMinutes(TimeElement time,
                                                       boolean dmy,
                                                       boolean monthAsString)
                                                                throws JPARSECException
        Converts a julian day into a date and time String.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        dmy - True to format as day-month-year, false for year-month-day.
        monthAsString - True to write the month as a string.
        Returns:
        The date and time formatted as a String.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the Julian day is invalid.

      • getLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getLocale(java.lang.String city)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns the Locale for a given city.
        Parameters:
        city - The city name.
        Returns:
        The Locale, or null if no Locale is available.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
